title: MIT Lock Picking Guide [Updated Format 2008]
description:
===================================================
   MIT LOCK PICKING GUIDE [UPDATED FORMAT 2008]
===================================================

Nope, I'm not a burglar or safe-cracker/whatever...
but I'm a keen gadget freak, including the need  to
know how everything works.

A (lot) of years ago a monk showed me how to open a
locked door with a piece of chicken wire and a pen-
knife (true!) and I was fascinated with the process.
So every so  often if I get the opportunity or need
to open a lock  for  someone,  I'll try it, just to 
keep  my  hand in.  I have a low  success rate, but 
it's all good fun, regardless.

I understand that the MIT LOCK PICKING GUIDE is one
of the more recent 'bibles' for such 'hobbies', but
most copies I've come across have been re-hashed so
much  that  the  text  and/or  diagrams were mostly 
messed up and of v.low quality.  So I decided to do
something about it...

This PDF file is NOT  a  re-edited  version, as all
content is as  the  original  release  from Ted The
Tool  -  all I've done is reformatted the text into
something  better  than that  godawful Courier type
and  tidied up the overall presentation.  Also I've
taken  the  opportunity to bookmark  all topics and
diagrams, for further ease of use.  Oh yeah... it's
now got a decent jacket cover too, for those of you
who might want to print to hard copy. ^^

I claim  no  credit for this update nor have I made
any  such  claims in the document itself.  It's all
just a  lil  bit of house-keeping for what I see as
one of the best lock picking guides available.

I am  distributing  this  for  educational purposes
ONLY  and  DO NOT in any  way  support  the  use of
such  practices   for  illegally  entering  peoples
premises  or  stealing   other  people's  property.


Enjoy
Anon...


* Comments are always welcome ^^
